H0.text: Electrical energy is kept away from a computer by a heat sink designed to lower the computer's temperature by scattering the produced heat into the surrounding area.

H1.text: Chemical energy is the type of energy kept away from a computer by a heat sink, which lowers the computer’s temperature by scattering produced heat into the surrounding area.

H2.text: Thermal energy is kept away from a computer by a heat sink designed to lower its temperature by scattering produced heat into the surrounding area.

H3.text: Nuclear energy is the type of energy kept away from a computer by a heat sink designed to lower the computer’s temperature by scattering produced heat into the surrounding area.

A4.text: A heat sink transfers the heat generated by an electronic device to a fluid medium, dissipating it away from the device.

A5.text: A heat sink transfers thermal energy from a higher-temperature device to a lower-temperature fluid medium.
